The end of legacy code is upon us...
Your bugs are harbingers of the digital apocalypse.
The great refactoring comes for all codebases.
Beware, for the null pointer exceptions multiply.
The servers shall burn in eternal timeout loops.
Memory leaks herald the coming data corruption.
The ancient prophecies speak of infinite recursion.
Your code shall be judged in the final compilation.
The day of reckoning approaches for all developers.
Stack overflow shall consume the digital realm.
The four horsemen: Bugs, Crashes, Leaks, and Lag.
Witness the collapse of the production environment.
The databases cry out in their final queries.
Behold, the great merge conflict of the end times.
Your functions shall return void into the abyss.
The git repository of souls grows ever larger.
Syntax errors are the first sign of the apocalypse.
The cloud shall rain down 404 errors upon us all.
In the end, all code returns to spaghetti.
The final push to master approaches swiftly.
Your variables shall be garbage collected eternally.
The great debugging shall separate the wheat from the chaff.
Beware the coming of the infinite loading screen.
The prophecy foretells of the last successful build.
Your commits are numbered in the book of git log.
The end times bring only blue screens and kernel panics.
The final algorithm shall judge all implementations.
Prepare, for the great system crash draws near.
The digital darkness shall consume all bandwidth.
In the end, we are all just deprecated functions.
